div.span: NAME OF EMPLOYED PERSON OR UNPAID APPRENTICE

p.style: font-size:11px; padding-top:-15px; margin-left:-16px; line-height:1;

div.p: 1. The correct National Insurance Number for each employed person must be shown in column 1. It is an offence not to do so.

p.style: font-size:11px; padding-top:-15px; line-height:1;

div.p: 4.Record value of contribution per week in column 6.

p.style: font-size:11px; font-weight:bold; margin-top:-15px; margin-left:-16px; line-height:1;

div.p: 2. Where new employees are hired in this contribution period add particulars N.I. number (if known), date of birth, and date employed. Attach completed NI 4 if National Insurance number is not known. For employees separated in this period state last date worked.

p.style: font-size:11px; margin-top:-20px; line-height:1;

div.p: 5.No contributions are due when Sickness, Maternity, Employment Injury or Invalidity Benefits are payable.

p.style: font-size:11px; margin-top:-16px; margin-left:-16px; line-height:1;

div.p: 3. Salary information must be included in column 5 for each employee

p.style: font-size:11px; margin-top:-55px; line-height:1;

div.p: 6.Submit this form with your payment and completed NI 187 by the last working day of the month reported on.

p.style: font-size:11px; font-weight:bold; margin-top:-15px; margin-left:-16px; line-height:1;

div.p: WARNING! THE LAW NOW IMPOSES A PENALTY FOR THE LATE SUBMISSION OF THIS INFORMATION AND FOR INCORRECT OR INCOMPLETE INFORMATION

p.style: font-size:11px;; margin-top:-60px; line-height:1;

div.p: 7. The Board will accept this information on diskette.
